title: Artificial Intelligence: Impacts and Applications
author: Micael da Silva Morais
excerpt: Discover the impact of artificial intelligence on our society and its applications.
content:
Artificial intelligence or AI is a technology developed to allow systems to simulate human intelligence, based on patterns from huge databases to go beyond specific programming, and to be able to make decisions.

The term artificial intelligence was first used in 1956 by John McCarthy, who can be considered one of the precursors of this technology. However, it does not have just one creator; it was a joint effort, and names such as Warren McCulloch, Walter Pitts and Alan Turing were essential for its development.

Where is artificial intelligence?

Nowadays, AI can be found everywhere, such as in factories, customer service systems, automobiles, cell phones, virtual assistants, on social networks and many other places.

It can be used to improve the online shopping experience, with tools that identify consumer behavior; in digital security, being able to identify threats, attacks and openings; and in services such as tractor automation and drone monitoring that can contribute to agriculture, for example.

The impacts of artificial intelligence on society

With the advancement of global technology, artificial intelligence ends up generating positive and negative impacts on society, making this a much-discussed topic.

  • Positive impacts: Optimization of productivity, automation of processes, creation of new content, and technological advancement.
  • Negative impacts: Technological dependence, data privacy issues, ethical conflicts, and unemployment.

Thus, the future of artificial intelligence will depend on how society manages its challenges, ensuring that it is used responsibly and inclusively with a focus on collective well-being.

title: What is Big Data?
author: Erivelton Silva de Araujo
excerpt: Learn about Big Data, its applications, impacts on society, and its future.
content:
Big Data refers to the set of technologies, tools and methods aimed at collecting, storing, processing and analyzing large volumes of data. This data can be structured, semi-structured or unstructured and is generated at high speed and in a variety of ways, coming from sources such as social networks, IoT sensors, financial records, among others. The concept emerged as a response to the need to deal with the exponential increase in information in the digital world.

Applications of Big Data

Big Data is widely used in various sectors, such as health, retail, security and public policy. Examples include:

  1. Public Health: Allows tracking disease outbreaks and epidemics in real time, personalizing treatments and predicting epidemiological patterns, contributing to more accurate and effective decisions.
  2. Marketing and Consumer Experience: Companies analyze data to create personalized campaigns, understand purchasing behaviors and improve customer loyalty.
  3. Public Policies: Governments use Big Data for predictive analysis and policy monitoring, enabling evidence-based decisions and improving resource allocation.

Impacts of Big Data on Society

The use of Big Data generates benefits, such as personalized services and technological advancement, but it also presents challenges, mainly ethical and legal. Among the benefits are innovation in predictive analysis and support for faster and more effective decisions. However, issues such as privacy, data security and responsible use are essential to ensure that this technology is applied ethically.

The Future of Big Data

The future of Big Data is aligned with the evolution of technologies such as artificial intelligence (AI) and the Internet of Things (IoT), which intensify its analytical capacity and applicability. This synergy offers significant opportunities for areas such as logistics, manufacturing and healthcare, but requires companies and governments to respect privacy regulations and promote ethical practices in data handling.
